revised_title: Absorption-Spectra of Bromine and Iodine Monochloride
tldr: The authors conducted a series of measurements to determine if the absorption spectra of bromine and iodine monochloride are identical, given their similar molecular weights and vapor colors. Using Kirchhoff's 4-prism spectroscope and a graphical method, they compared the wave-lengths of the absorption bands and found that the spectra are not identical, even when examined at different temperatures or varying gas column lengths.
